content: Started coding journey at NITR with C programming in first year, still remember the excitement of writing first 'Hello World' program in the computer lab
Became addicted to Valorant during pandemic lockdown, reached Diamond rank playing Sage and Omen, favorite map is Bind
Arsenal fan since college days, never missed a match during NITR years, used to gather with friends in hostel common room to watch Premier League
Turned vegetarian in second year of college after visiting animal shelter during NSS activity, never looked back since then
Currently working on a React Native app project in spare time, reminds me of final year project where we built Android app using Java
Valorant team chemistry with college friends still intact after graduation, we have a Discord server called 'NITR Radiants' for daily gaming sessions
Follow Indian Super League religiously now, but EPL will always be first love, Thierry Henry poster still hangs in home office
Favorite vegetarian protein sources include paneer, dal, quinoa, and Greek yogurt - learned to cook these during bachelor days in Rourkela
Nostalgic about NITR's Aarohan fest where we organized coding competitions, miss the energy and enthusiasm of college technical events
Learning Python during engineering sparked interest in data science, now working with pandas and matplotlib for personal analytics projects
Valorant rank progression from Iron to Diamond took 2 years, same dedication I had for mastering algorithms during competitive programming at NITR
Football knowledge expanded from just watching to understanding tactics, formations, and transfer markets - became obsession during college years
Vegetarian cooking skills improved significantly at 40, can now make restaurant-quality dal makhani and palak paneer from scratch
NITR campus walks during evening hours were therapeutic, especially around the lake - miss those peaceful moments between study sessions
GitHub profile shows progression from college projects to professional work, first repository was uploaded during third year at NITR
Valorant community became second family, especially NITR batch mates who moved to different cities but still squad up every weekend
Fantasy Premier League addiction started in final year, still maintaining same league with college friends after 15+ years
Vegetarian diet philosophy strengthened over years, now advocate for plant-based nutrition among friends and family
Current tech stack includes React, Node.js, and MongoDB - evolution from college days when we primarily used C++, Java, and MySQL
Valorant mechanics training routine inspired by disciplined study schedule from NITR days - 1 hour daily aim training and deathmatch
Football analysis hobby grew from casual watching to understanding xG statistics, heat maps, and tactical breakdowns
Vegetarian meal prep strategy includes batch cooking lentils, quinoa salads, and protein smoothies for busy work weeks
NITR library Level 3 was coding sanctuary during placement preparation, solved over 500 LeetCode problems in that corner desk
Open source contributions started during final semester, first pull request was fixing documentation bug in popular Python library
Valorant agent preferences evolved from duelist main to controller/sentinel flex player, reflects maturity in both gaming and life

The best places to visit in Japan include Tokyo, Kyoto, and Osaka. Tokyo is known for its blend of traditional and modern attractions, while Kyoto offers a rich cultural heritage with numerous temples and shrines. Osaka, often referred to as the "Dining Capital of Japan," features vibrant street food scenes and lively entertainment districts.

2. The AI assistant confirmed it doesn't have feelings but is ready to help and asked how it can assist the user.

1. User needs suggestions for Indian vegetarian curry dishes.
2. Assistant recommends Paneer Makhani, Chana Masala, and Aloo Gobi as great options.
